H0.text: A planet is a bright object with a long tail of glowing gases that is in orbit around the Sun.

H1.text: A star is the bright object with a long tail of glowing gases that is in orbit around the Sun.

H2.text: An asteroid is a bright object with a long tail of glowing gases that is in orbit around the Sun.

H3.text: A comet is a bright object with a long tail of glowing gases that orbits around the Sun.

A4.text: Ion tails have been observed to extend one astronomical unit (150 million km) or more.

A5.text: As a comet approaches the inner Solar System, solar radiation causes the volatile materials within the comet to vaporize and stream out of the nucleus, carrying dust away with them.
